intro: Oxytropis krylovii, commonly known as Krylov's locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the steppes and semi-desert regions of Central Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, characterized by its erect stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in raceme inflorescences, which bloom in the summer months. It is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access water. Oxytropis krylovii is also known for its toxic properties, containing alkaloids that can be harmful to livestock.
